title: Removes statutory requirement that health officers and registered environmental health specialists employed by municipalities receive maximum salary within their range within five years from date of appointment.
Establishes Class Three special law enforcement officers to provide security in public and nonpublic schools and county colleges.
Revises provisions of law concerning graduation proficiency test and eliminates requirement that graduation proficiency test be administered in eleventh grade.
Allows for the establishment of a "County Tenant Legal Assistance Program" in each county; requires portion of the administrative fee for residential mortgage execution sales fund the program.
Requires State entities to recycle certain materials and provide recycling bins in State buildings.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross tax returns for New Jersey Commission on Cancer Research.

Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act"; establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank within NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust; renames NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust.
Extends transmittal date deadline for fiscal year 2019-2020 gubernatorial budget message to Legislature from fourth Tuesday in February to March 5, 2019.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Dedicates one percent of cigarette and other tobacco products tax revenues to anti-smoking initiatives.**
Eliminates requirement that public-private partnership agreements for construction of certain higher education facilities be submitted to EDA for review and approval by certain dates.
Establishes Statewide Assessment Review Task Force.
Designates July 1 of each year as "U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps Day."
Directs Dept. of Agriculture to develop and implement beginning farmer mentoring program in cooperation with certain agricultural and educational organizations and entities.
Requires school bus operations in State to comply with certain federal regulations.
Establishes process for consideration of offers from short sale buyers during residential mortgage foreclosures.
Makes certain body searches third degree crime of sexual assault under certain circumstances.
Prohibits State-sponsored travel to certain states without protections against discrimination based on sex, gender identity or expression, and affectional or sexual orientation.*
Requires AG to conduct survey of untested sexual assault examination kits.
Commends decision to move United States Embassy in Israel from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.
Makes General Fund supplemental appropriation of $350,000 to DMVA for Council on Armed Forces and Veterans' Affairs for preservation of military installations in case of base realignment and closure.
Criminalizes sale and possession of certain firearm components.
Creates New Jersey Cold War medal.
Prohibits MVC from charging fee for restoring driver's license suspended due to mental or physical condition.
Provides transition period of 90 days during which building service employees subject to certain building service transfers must be retained.
Amends Constitution to require State to make payments in lieu of taxes to municipalities for certain preserved open space.
Modifies support limit for nonpublic security aid to equal per pupil appropriation for security aid for public schools.
Requires DLPS to issue guidelines for counties to establish special needs registries.
Permits sale of certain alcoholic beverages and related products at seasonal farm markets.
Exempts construction, expansion, or renovation of building or structure owned and used by municipality or volunteer fire department from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Authorizes restricted breweries to annually sell up to 1,000 barrels of beer to in-State and out-of-state retailers.
Provides that deed restrictions on affordable housing units are not extinguished by foreclosure proceedings.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.
Allows qualified school to be called "New Jersey Farm Fresh School."
"Medical Aid in Dying for the Terminally Ill Act"; permits qualified terminally ill patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner.*
"Medical Aid in Dying for the Terminally Ill Act"; permits qualified terminally ill patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner.*
Authorizes free admission to State parks and forests for certain veterans, military personnel, first responders, and police.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Requires public members of Drug Utilization Review Board to disclose financial interests and benefits received from and investment interests held in pharmaceutical manufacturers.
Authorizes active duty military to fish in freshwaters without license or trout stamp.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Establishes crime of "sexual extortion": using explicit sexual images to extort victims.
Urges Congress to pass "Palliative Care and Hospice Education and Training Act" and fund initiatives to expand palliative care.
Permits BPU to approve qualified wind energy project; requires BPU to provide application periods for those projects.
Requires foreign corporations providing electronic communication services or remote computing services to comply with New Jersey subpoenas, court orders and search warrants.

Authorizes the EDA to issue additional $50,000,000 in bonds to provide grants for certain county vocational school district facilities projects and increases debt service district aid percentage for such projects.
Requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Provides changes to transportation planning and funding process to reduce costs of certain transportation infrastructure projects.
Harmonizes the disqualifying offenses and certain other criminal history record background check requirements applicable to home instructors employed under DOE or DHS authority.
Imposes mandatory term of life imprisonment without eligibility for parole on persons who commit particularly brutal sexual assaults.
Requires insurers writing homeowners insurance policies in the State to offer certain coverage for heating oil tanks.
